desc.en: Sydney is well-known as the first major city in Australia. Its public transport system is managed by the state-owned TransportNSW. As being the only state (excluding ACT) which has 1435mm track gauges in Australia, the TransportNSW also manages a colossal intercity railway and coach network from Sydney, extending out to Brisbane, Canberra and state of Victoria.

updateHistory.reason: New template of Sydney including trains metro light rails and intercity extensions
Updated Metro M1 city section which has opened on 19 Aug 2024 III Added 2 new metro lines according to plans from NSW governmenrt III Included ferry network

Redirected T3 to go via Regents Park then added T6 from Lidcombe to Bankstown and L4 from Westmead to Carlingford and L5 from Parramatta Square to Carter Street and F10 from Barangaroo to Blackwattle Bay and replacement bus service between Sydenham to Bankstown
